intro: Centropogon vulpinus var. sonsonensis, commonly known as the Sonsonense Centropogon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
